item.title: Beyond Science: Drafting My First Book ‚úçÔ∏è
item.description:
Not every passion fits neatly into equations or simulations. I believe a person can’t be fully defined by their profession, and while engineering and research are core to who I am, I don‚Äôt want to be known only as a scientist.

What brings me a different kind of fulfillment is the artistic, reflective side ‚Äî the part that enjoys storytelling, introspection, and creative expression. It‚Äôs not about completing myself with work, but about understanding myself through multiple lenses.

item.title: Hobbies üé®
item.description:
When I’m not untangling research chaos, I unwind by philosophizing about the cosmos and the planets with aero-astro friends or my space enthusiast guys and waging dramatic battles on the chessboard, where I‚Äôm proudly in my ‚Äòintermediate but plotting world domination‚Äô era.

I also like playing guitar and love listening to melancholic music, Whenever I spot a guitar in the room, I instinctively pick it up to check if my muscle memory has survived its 3‚Äì4 year sabbatical. Some days I surprise myself, other days the strings remind me why I switched to science.
